title: 2025 Offloads East
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider is also equipped with an Innovasea MobileRX and VMT attached to the towbody with both hydrophone heads pointing backwards, an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, an Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull, and float-mounted Seabird GPCTD+DO. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers making up the OTN HaliBT and NCAT Lines.

deployment_details.deployment_personnel: Byrne T, L'Orsa S, Mar M, Wilks N, Van Der Meer J
deployment_details.recovery_personnel: L'Orsa S, Viva Z, Wilks N, Allan J

Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted under float of wave glider.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

DO 43F - 43-3801
PUMP - 6853

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.
model: 43F

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

Oxygen instrument output in Hz but should be converted to dissolved oxygen concentration in mol m-3 (incorporating GPCTD temperature, salinity and pressure values).

2021-Dec-21 Calibration:
Coefficients:
Soc = 3.3990e-004
Foffset = -837.29
Tau20 = 1.42
A = -4.4491e-003
B = 7.7529e-005
C = -6.8801e-007
E nominal = 0.036

Nominal Dynamic Coefficients:
D1 = 1.92634e-4
D2 = -4.64803e-2
H1 = -3.300000e-2
H2 = 5.00000e+3
H3 = 1.45000e+3

instrument.comment:
LRI GPSWaves software receives selected inputs from: the 1Hz GPS included with the Wave Glider system and a LORD Microstrain GPS-Aided Inertial Navigation System (GPS/INS) device.

LORD Microstrain serial number: 6251-4220.102124

This is the serial number of SV3-1071 Wave Glider CCU drybox.

Dual AIS Receiver. Temperature range for operation: -25 to +55 degrees C.
RX Ch1: 156.025 - 161.975 MHz at 25kHz BW
RX Ch2: 156.075 - 162.025 MHz at 25kHz BW

Receives and outputs all standard AIS Messages defined in ITU-R M.1371-5 and anticipated future messages.

data_logger.name: CCU
data_logger.comment:
vid=117426951, drybox s/n: 009897

cell modem: MultiTech MultiConnect® Dragonfly™ embedded System-On-Module (PN MTQ-H5-B02), USB 2.0. Robust antenna utilizes Laird™TRA6927M3PBN-001 in robust enclosure, mounted to a 0.5m mast.

instrument.long_name: Airmar DX900+ MultiLog (electromagnetic)  water speed sensor
instrument.comment: Electromagnetic - MultiLog Sensor - capable of measuring speed and temperature. Mounted at the forward end of the forward payload bay of Wave Glider, thru-hull. Provides water speed input to the core vehicle.

instrument.comment:
VR4-UWM specifically designed to be mounted on a wave glider. Dual receiver channel frequencies - 69 kHz and 180 kHz and benthos underwater modem. 

Towed from the Wave Glider sub on a towfish several meters below water.

Purchased 12/12/2022

A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider will offload VR4 receivers making up the OTN HaliBT and NCAT Lines.
